name: Quasiperfect number
summary:
In mathematics, a quasiperfect number is a natural number n for which the sum of all its divisors (the sum-of-divisors function 
  
    
      
        Ïƒ
        (
        n
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle \sigma (n)}
  
) is equal to 
  
    
      
        2
        n
        +
        1
      
    
    {\displaystyle 2n+1}
  
. Equivalently, n is the sum of its non-trivial divisors (that is, its divisors excluding 1 and n). No quasiperfect numbers have been found so far.
